posts.title: CLIFF WALLACE at MILKandLEAD
posts.content:
CLIFF WALLACE works as a special effects makeup artist in England. he started his career on Clive Barker ‘s Hellraiser in 1985. Since then he has worked on over fifty movies including films for Ken Russell, Brian De Palma, Ridley Scott, Danny Boyle, Guillermo Del Toro and Steven Spielberg.

Since 2009 he has been exhibiting sculptures at galleries throughout Europe and the United States.

Traditionally his sculptures are made first in clay, then moulded in silicone and cast in translucent resin.

More details about Cliff Walllace and his company creature effects, can be found at www.creature-effects.com

posts.title: Lee Adams at MILKandLEAD דיאליזה
posts.content:
The Sacred Conspirancy

“Man has escaped from his head just as the condemned man has escaped from his prison. He has found beyond himself not God, who is the prohibition against crime, but a being who is unaware of prohibition. Beyond what I am, I meet a being who makes me laugh because he is headless; this fills me with dread because he is made of innocence and crime; He holds a steel weapon in his left hand, flames like those of a Sacred Heart in his right. He reunites in the same eruption Birth and Death. He is not a man. He is not a god either. He is not me but he is more than me: his belly is the labyrinth in which he has lost himself, loses me with him, and in which I discover myself as him, in other words as a monster.”

Georges Bataille – The Sacred Conspiracy, from Visions of Excess – Selected Writings 1927 – 1939

The Sacred Conspirancy, performed as part of Ron Athey‘s History of Ecstasy, co-commisioned by Museo d’Arte Contemporanea Donna Regina (MADRE) and Napoli Teatro Festival Italia. 2009.

 

 

 

Video and Editing:

Karolina Urbaniak

http://karolinaurbaniak.com/
